text:
User
Guide for the Breaking Wave OTL

is used for generating breaking ocean waves. This asset
allows the user the create the geometry, animation, shading and
whitewater for the wave.

The
breaking wave digital asset exists within the

, then
dive inside it, delete the default
This is the height of the wave.

This is the length of a wave from
                        one crest/or trough to another.

The location to put down the
                        breaking wave.

This is the overall smoothness of
                        the surface. It controls the amount the wave surface is
                        subdivided.

This is the number of iterations
                        of the fractal Brownian motion noise on the wave surface.

Displacement amount of the height
                        of the fractal noise on the wave surface.

Choose whether the animation is
                        using an Auto or a Custom control.

This is the point along the
                                center of the cross-section wave profile curves that the wave
                                starts to break.
How wide the breaking wave is.

Adds non-linear variation to the
                                wave shape. When the Falloff is greater than 1, it has an ease
                                out effect on the breaking wave. If the Falloff is less than 1,
                                the life-cycle of the breaking wave tends to be shorter.

Controls the evolution of a
                                breaking wave. 0 means at the beginning of the breaking wave’s
                                life-cycle. As the value increases, the wave shape evolves and
                                deforms out of the centre line of the surface. Time = 1 means
                                that the wave reaches the very end of its life-cycle.

How fast the wave is moving
                                forward.

Controls the evolution of a
                                single breaking wave profile curve.

This is the forward motion of a
                                single breaking wave profile curve.

This is whether to display the
                                particles or not.

How long the particle will live
                                (in seconds).

Particles will live the number of
                                seconds in Life expectancy, plus or minus this number of seconds.
                                Use 0 for no variance.
Set or add to velocity attribute.

Variance to the initial velocity
                                set above

This is how strong the attractor
                                (moving along the surface) affects the particles moving
                                direction.

Number of iterations of fractal
                                noise to add.

Spatial frequency of noise field
                                in X, Y, and Z.

This is how strong the gravity
                                affects the particles.

This is whether to display the
                                particles or not.

How long the particle will live
                                (in seconds).

Particles will live the number of
                                seconds in Life expectancy, plus or minus this number of seconds.
                                Use 0 for no variance.
Set or add to velocity attribute.

Variance to the initial velocity
                                set above

How high the particles will
                                travel.

How wide the particles will
                                travel.

Overall scale of the jitter
                                effect.

This is how strong the gravity
                                affects the particles.

The contribution of diffuse to
                                the material.

This controls the size or spread
                                of the diffuse contribution.

This value is used to tint the
                                color of the shadow.

This is used to control the
                                intensity of the returned color.

The color used to tint the color
                                returned from the subsurface scatter calculation.

This is the Index of Refraction
                                used in the subsurface scattering calculation to determine how
                                muchlight bends as it pass through the surface.
travels after it pass through the surface.

This toggle will change the
                                normal to face forward towards the camera. It is recommended this
                                toggle be on.

A multiplier for the specular
                                contribution to the material.

This value controls the size or
                                spread of the specular highlight. If Anisotropic is selected,
                                this value controls the specular highlight in only the

If Anisotropic is selected, this
                                value controls the specular highlight in only the
direction. It is ignored with any other specular function.

This value controls the sharpness
                                of the edge of the specular highlight. It is used only if Glossy
                                specular is selected.

A selector for the specular
                                function.

A multiplier for the reflection
                                contribution to the material.

This is a tint color for
                                reflections.

A multiplier for the refraction
                                contribution to the material.

This is a tint color for
                                refraction.

This determines how much the ray
                                bends as it passes from one material into another. Usually for
                                water this is 1.333.

This controls how randomly the
                                samples are distributed.

This is typically a small number
                                used to help solve self-intersection issues.

The number samples to calculate.
                                The more samples, the better the quality, the slower the render.

If there is the path to a texture
                                here and ray trace is turned off, then this map is used to
                                calculate the reflection contribution. If ray trace is on and
                                there is a texture, then the texture color is returned, when the
                                ray does not hit anything.

he reflection ray used to do the
                                look up in the map is transformed into this space.

This color is returned when the
                                ray does not hit anything and there is no environment map
                                specified.

This is the scale of the noise
                                pattern. Larger values give smaller, but not more detailed,
                                patterns. Smaller values will benefit from higher Octaves values.

This vector positions the noise
                                on the object in x, y and z.

This value shifts the median
                                value of the noise by passing it through a power function. Values
                                greater than 1, will dampen the noise down, whereas values less
                                than 1 will sharpen the contrast between the noise values.

Control the size of the space
                                between the rough areas.

Control the height of the rough
                                areas.
